medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset, constant, severe abdominal pain located in the epigastrum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started at 12pm on ___ and has been constant. The patient experienced associated emesis twice, slight darkening of urine, and noted no change in stool habits or color. Pain radiated to the back. Morphine provided relief.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Atrial fibrillation 2. History of DVT and saddle pulmonary embolism 3. Hypertension 4. Diabetes Mellitus (NIDDM) 5. Depression 6. Angina 7. GERD 8. Nephrolithiasis 9. Asthma.
